alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 29 at 12:15PM EDT until April 01 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Oconee affecting Washington, Wilkinson and Johnson Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Oconee. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Major flooding occurs. Most of Old Balls Ferry Road north of Georgia Highway 57 will be under one to three feet of water. The water level reaches the bottom of the USGS gaging equipment near the boat ramp. Widespread flooding up to several feet deep of the woodlands near the river occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 25.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM EDT Wednesday was 25.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.8 feet on 04/09/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
